title: Woodville West: Man dies in horror motorbike crash
text:
A rider has been killed and his motorbike thrown across a main road following a crash in Adelaide’s western suburbs.

Emergency services were called to Gawler Rd in Woodville West just before 7.30pm on Sunday.

Initial reports were that a motorcyclist was left pinned after crashing into a parked car.

The man’s motorbike was sent flying across Findon Rd, coming to rest on the opposite pavement, its front light still working despite the force of the collision.

media_camera Police gather at the scene of a serious crash in Woodville West.

MedStar personnel were at the scene treating the 31-year-old man from Hectorville, but he died at the scene.

Major Crash investigators examined the circumstances surrounding the crash overnight, which saw the northbound closure of Findon Rd at Trimmer Pde, as well as Gawler St.

The man's death brings the road toll to 86, compared with 57 at the same time last year.
description: A motorcyclist has been killed and his bike thrown 50m across a main road after he crashed into a parked car in Woodville West on Sunday night.
